Description: Upper body sherd of Chian, possibly early patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; exterior: reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The lack of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces of the sherd make it difficult to determine to what style it belongs. Early patterned chalices have no decoration on either side of the chalice walls.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0274) (phase 2)
